content.question: An object attached to a vertically oriented spring on Earth oscillates in simple harmonic motion with a period <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the spring-object system is transported to a planet whose acceleration due to gravity is twice that of Earth and the mass of the object is quadrupled, what is the new period of the oscillating system?
